channel.title: Stupid 5 number generator
channel.description:
Since there is a 'domain giveaway' going on, and I can never pick numbers, I wrote a simple program (very sloppy i might add) to do this for me. It generates 5 numbers (between 1 and 100), then chooses one of the 5 to set red (the suggested number). Could serve as like, "guess a number" game between your friends, since even you will not know the number, and there is no cheating.
[img]http://true-programas.netii.net/images/1292869517.png[/img]
Source: http://pastebin.com/gt3h5rcs
Web Applet: http://true-programas.netii.net/rn/
Davidi2 gets some creds, as the 'addComponent' method was from his chat, and I stole the imports from it as well, but eeh, those arent as big of a deal.

item.title: Stupid 5 number generator
item.dc:creator: @pure2ownage Pure_
item.description:
@pure2ownage wrote:

[quote=“CoonHunter, post:25, topic:374034”][quote author=Fat Cookies link=topic=470015.msg3437461#msg3437461 date=1292868387]

package ownd;

/**
 *
 * @author fc
 * 
 */
public class Bob {

    public static void main(String[] args) {

        for (int i = 0; i < 5; i++) {
            System.out.print((int) (Math.random() * 99) + 1 + " ");
        }
        System.out.println();
    }
}

brb being just as productive without all the shit.
[/quote]
Again, I was not going for a clean version, I simply wanted to write it for shits and giggles.[/quote]orly

Read full topic

item.title: Stupid 5 number generator
item.dc:creator: @CoonHunter CoonHunter
item.description:
@CoonHunter wrote:

Davidi2:

What sites are those? I’m curious as to mine ._.

Didn’t use a site, its a program called:
CPU Speed Pro

Tomorrow I will install it onto my desktop (which is only a year old) to see what it benchmarks the processor on that. I’m skeptical though about how well this works, because for shits and giggles did it 10 more times, all reading 67-75MHz, which i know would mean my computer practically crashed, but the constant readings of that range prove its not randomly generated.

Read full topic

item.description:
@CoonHunter wrote:

Davidi2:

Don’t BS me I have 768mb of RAM and a slower processor, I can run Netbeans or Eclipse just fine

My processor caps out at a lower speed than 1.3GHz. The processor itself is a 1.6GHz, but its going bad. I’ll see if I can clock its speed to show ya.

Just booting installer for program:

Free Web Hosting

Absolutely Free Web Hosting with PHP, MySQL, cPanel and no Ads!

item.title: Stupid 5 number generator
item.dc:creator: @davidi2 Davidi2
item.description:
@davidi2 wrote:

[quote=“CoonHunter, post:14, topic:374034”][quote author=John459 link=topic=470015.msg3436682#msg3436682 date=1292800133]

import java.awt.*; import java.awt.event.*; import java.io.*; import java.net.*; import java.text.*; import java.util.*; import java.util.concurrent.*;

Is it a coincidence that you ask me for my chat client code, and then your GUI has the same method names, and imports as my client GUI? XD

Yes, that I am too lazy to sort through all of the imports to find what I didn’t need. The method names though, eeh, that would be somewhat of a coincidence. I suppose it would be a good idea though to sort through the imports, and see what is really needed.

Use an ide?
[/quote]
My laptops processor caps fast. 1.3GHz, windows 7 (idle is at 7-8%, youtube running, makes it 40-50%), so using an IDE and listening to music like I do, would cap it. Thing is already going bad as is[/quote] Don’t BS me I have 768mb of RAM and a slower processor, I can run Netbeans or Eclipse just fine

Read full topic

import java.awt.*; import java.awt.event.*; import java.io.*; import java.net.*; import java.text.*; import java.util.*; import java.util.concurrent.*;

Is it a coincidence that you ask me for my chat client code, and then your GUI has the same method names, and imports as my client GUI? XD

Yes, that I am too lazy to sort through all of the imports to find what I didn’t need. The method names though, eeh, that would be somewhat of a coincidence. I suppose it would be a good idea though to sort through the imports, and see what is really needed.
[/quote]

Use an ide?[/quote]
My laptops processor caps fast. 1.3GHz, windows 7 (idle is at 7-8%, youtube running, makes it 40-50%), so using an IDE and listening to music like I do, would cap it. Thing is already going bad as is.

Davidi2:

initializeCompontent and addComponent, same arguments as well

I do initializeComponent in C# as well tbh. I do admit, addComponent was straight from your chat though (forgot to give cred’s on that, as I initially wasn’t thinking on posting. The method just made adding things much easier lol.
